content.description: Crack climb.
content.protection: Medium to Large Pro
content.location: 'Waynes Blue Eyes' is the crack to the left of 'Tendon Teaser'

content.description: Really enjoyable face climbing. Good finger pockets to start. Climb past a horizontal crack. Thin in the middle (crux) and over the bulge with an easy finish.
content.protection: Six bolts to bolted anchors with a link to rap from.
content.location: Face climb to the right of 'Waynes Blue Eyes' and to the left of 'Mr. Solo'.

content.description: Face climb start. Midway you can use a crack on the right.
content.protection: three bolts to two bolt anchor

content.description: Face climb, between 'The Jester' and 'Dr. Giggles'.
content.protection: Five bolts to two bolt anchor.

content.description: Climb the arete to the right of Lumberjack. A small bulge midway up is the crux. Lots of good stances to contemplate the next moves.
content.protection: 8 bolts to 3 bolt anchor with rap rings
content.location: Right of Lumberjack which is under an oak just outside of pancake house.

content.description: Short and tricky face climb.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the far left (South) of 'The Throne' area, just before you get to 'Pancake House' area. Route faces South.

content.description: Bolted face climb in the Universe Wall section of 'The Throne'. There is some rotten rock here and a lead fall could cause the climber to hit the opposite climbing wall. Wear a helmet!
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Universe wall is the first climbing area you come to as you descend the climbers trail (furthest North). 'Reciprocity' is the bolted face just to the left of the chimney corner crack 'Chimney Sweep' and faces the other climbs on this wall.

content.description: Hand crack climbing with pretty good feet too.
content.protection: Large Nuts and small cams.
content.location: This crack is the crack between Waynes blue eyes crack (to the left) and Crackerjack Crack (to the left). It's just to the right of Tendon Teaser.

content.description: I found the route to have 2 tough spots, one right off the start, and the crux was coming out over the bulge above the last horizontal crack.
content.protection: Bolts to bolted anchors. The first bolt is very high off the ground.
content.location: If you look at the photo you can find Moon Line just to the right of the crack.

content.description: Starting is the hardest part, climb sloping pockets with good feet to first bolt, the rest of the way is striat forward, climb past several more bolts to rings
content.protection: 6 bolts+, rings
content.location: The thone area, belay is outside the throne by a medium sized tree.

content.description: Face climbing just right of the easily spotted Crackerjack Crack.
content.protection: four bolts to two bolt anchor

content.description: Much more interesting and enjoyable than it appears at the bottom. Face divided by some horizontal breaks. Nice cruxy little bulge at top. A good warm up route.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt rap
content.location: Just to the right of Lumberjack.

content.description: A sub-5.11 start using a bit of crack and then the business starts.  The crux is after the second bolt.  Very thin, very steep and sustained, and kind of runout to the next bolt.  Then it eases it off considerably toward the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Just right of the only crack climb on the face, Mr. Solo.  An 11d is right of Frequent Flyer and then Earth Angel, 11a, right of that.

content.description: Climb the vertical seam crux to easier climbing above. After moving through easier climbing in a crack, move onto the arete for the final moves, eventually finishing at a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor. May want to bring some small trad for better protection between the bolts.
content.location: Farthest right route on 'Universe Wall'. This is the northern most route in 'The Throne' area. Start at the vertical seam and crack.

content.description: Start on run out, but easy ground (5.6).  I started in a seam to the left of the main face.  Clip the first bolt and move onto the steeper face.  The face is steep but has big holds for the area.  Finish with a fun move over a bulge.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chain anchors
content.location: The route farthest left when facing the throne wall.  It looks relatively featured and is left of a 5.6 crack.

content.description: Small one and two finger pockets up a bulge.  Nice gritty rock. Crux is getting to the 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts.  Anchors at top.
content.location: In between Frequent Flyer and Earth Angel.

content.description: Climb face on small pockets, crimps, and smears. There is no distinct crux, but multiple difficult moves.  Due to the sustained nature, it might feel harder than the given grade.  The climbing is very good though.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chain anchors
content.location: The fourth bolted route from the left side of the Throne.  There is a crack and three short bolted routes to the right of it.

climbs.name: Dr. Giggles
climbs.fa: Rich Lemal, Rick Lake, Brian Pauli (10/1993)

content.description: Fun sustained face climing. Highly recommended!
content.protection: Four bolts to two bolt anchor

climbs.name: The Devil Made Me Do It

content.description:
3 Bolt face/arete with horizontal cracks. 2 bolt rap (Karabin guide description). 

  This route has been extended to the top of the cliff with an extra 3(?) bolts.
content.protection: ~6bolts + anchors
content.location: Universe Wall, first bolt line you come across on your way to Throne/Pancake House

content.description: Great short and pumpy route. May be best to walk off since the anchors are really far back on the top of the formation making for an almost impossible rope drag when lowering off. If you want to top-rope this or the 5.11 to the left of it I would suggest hiking to the top and bringing a long piece of webbing - long enough to clear the edge.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchors (terrible rope drag position for anchors)
content.location: Route is between Pancake House and The Throne. From the pancake house hike along the wall and continue up through the evil bushes to the base of the climb.

content.description: Fun little trad lead. Difficulty is fairly consistent throughout. It may be slightly easier than rated.
content.protection: Nuts and smallish to medium cams, easily protected. No top anchor but you can use one nearby on the route to the right if you want to setup a top rope more easily.
content.location: Obvious crack in middle of throne area. Good sized tree near base.

content.description: Open book corner crack chimney in the Universe Wall area of 'The Throne'. Although the route has some loose rock, they chimney style climbing is lots of fun. Please wear a helmet if you're going to climb or belay this one!
content.protection: Trad pro (small and very large) to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Universe wall is the first climbing wall you see from the climbers trail to 'the throne'. 'Chimney Sweep' is the obvious corner in this area (to the right of 'Reciprocity' and to the left of 'Moon line'.

content.description: Small Pockets, and a few friction moves
content.protection: 5 bolts, top anchors
content.location: repel though the backside of the Pancake house or hike around

content.description: This is the northern section of the western slope of Upper Devils Canyon, as specified in Marty Karabin's guides. Several easier to moderate routes are here and the area seems to be popular with climbers. This includes everything from Screaming Demons (5.11a) north to Free Booty (5.9)
